text.text: How do I configure the billing process settings in ZOLL Billing, and what options are available?

text: The billing process section defines the clearinghouse you use by their identifier and HMAC. Here you also select the following options: Run patient tasks: This setting controls when patient invoices are sent. Process claim status rules: These are the status change rules such as submitted to follow-up after 30 days, etc. Submit claims to the clearinghouse: Enable this setting to allow ZOLL Billing to send completed claims to the clearinghouse. Process clearinghouse remittances: Enable this setting to allow ZOLL Billing to.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the "Run patient tasks" setting in the billing process configuration?

text: If it is not checked, the claims will sit in queued for submission and an invoice will not be created for the patient.

text.text: What is the purpose of the "Process claim status rules" option in the billing process settings?

text: These are the status change rules such as submitted to follow-up after 30 days, etc.

text.text: How do I enable ZOLL Billing to submit claims to the clearinghouse?

text: To enable ZOLL Billing to submit claims to the clearinghouse, you need to enable the "Submit claims to the clearinghouse" setting in the billing process section.

text.text: What actions does enabling the "Process clearinghouse remittances" setting allow ZOLL Billing to perform?

text: Enabling the "Process clearinghouse remittances" setting allows ZOLL Billing to Account Letter casing of patient names and addresses.

text.text: How can I change the letter casing of patient names and addresses?

text: To change the letter casing of patient names and addresses, you can use the following steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Settings > Account. 2. The system defaults to "Leave patient names and address unchanged".

text.text: What options are available for configuring level of service favorites?

text: The only level of services that you mark as favorites display in the selection boxes on the Level of service & diagnosis tab when you are working incomplete claims. You can still select a non-favorite level of service by clicking the Show all box to expand the list.

text.text: Can you guide me through the process of setting up the reporting start date in ZOLL Billing Insights?

text:
To set up the reporting start date in ZOLL Billing Insights, you can use the following steps:
1. On the navigation bar, click Settings > Reporting.
2. In the Reporting start date field, enter the date that you want to use as the start date for your reports.
3. Click Save.
The reporting start date will be used for all reports that you generate in ZOLL Billing Insights.

text.text: How do I enable and configure the integration with ZOLL Dispatch?

text:
To enable and configure the integration with ZOLL Dispatch, you can use the following steps:
1. In the "Enable integration with ZOLL Dispatch" box, check the box.
2. To select call types to import, in the "Do not import" box, click a call type to highlight.
3. Use the center arrows to move the call type from the "Do not import" box to the "Import" box.
4. Click Save.

text.text: What options are available for filtering call types and vehicles to import from ZOLL Dispatch?

text: To select vehicles to import, you can use the following steps: 1. In the "Do not import" box, click a vehicle to highlight. 2. Use the center arrows to move the call type from the "Do not import" box to the "Import" box. 3. Click Save.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of the patient billing settings in ZOLL Billing, particularly regarding patient statements?

text: The patient billing settings in ZOLL Billing allow you to set the number of days between patient statements and the number of total statements. The schedule tells the system how often to send a patient statement and the maximum statements to send. You can edit this schedule at any time by clicking the edit pencil.

text.text: How does enabling the "Invoice a patient by default" option affect patient billing in ZOLL Billing?

text: The "Invoice a patient by default" option in ZOLL Billing allows the system to send an invoice whenever the patient is the current payer. When this option is enabled, the system automatically suspends the claim with a status of "Suspended - Write-off pending".

text.text: What is the significance of enabling the "Suspend patient billing by default" option in patient billing settings?

text: The "Suspend patient billing by default" option in ZOLL Billing allows you to suspend the patient billing by default. When you select this option, anytime a claim is created for a patient or anytime a payment is posted and the claim moves into patient billing, the system automatically suspends the claim with a status of "Suspended - write-off pending".

text.text: How can I choose a patient statement vendor in ZOLL Billing, and what factors should I consider?

text: The patient statement vendor is set up during onboarding and it is recommended that you do not change it unless you consult with ZOLL first. When you select this option, anytime a claim is created for a patient or anytime a payment is posted and the claim moves into patient billing, the system automatically suspends the claim with a status of "Suspended - write-off pending".

text.text: What components can be customized on a patient statement in ZOLL Billing?

text: The patient statement page shows the patient's propensity-to-pay, current patient responsibility, running balance, and statement details.

text.text: How does the "Deductible monitoring" feature work in ZOLL Billing, and when might it be useful?

text: ZOLL Billing's Deductible Monitoring feature allows you to oversee deductible holds with features such as automated monitoring, customizable threshold settings, and visibility into the list of held claims. Deductible Monitoring can operate automatically, with users defining parameters while the system handles the process, or manually, where the Biller manually adjusts the claim's status.

text.text: Can you explain how to enable and utilize the automated payment plan feature

text: To enable the automated payment plan feature, you need to hover over Manage on the navigation bar, click Settings, and then click the Configuration tab. Scroll down to the bottom and find "Automated payment plan". When this feature is enabled, all accounts with payment plans defined and enabled will be automatically monitored to timely payment. Enter the number of days between the plan payments and then click Save.

text.text: What steps are involved in configuring the number of days between plan payments in ZOLL Billing?

text: To change the schedule, you need to go to the Configuration tab and scroll down to the "Patient billing" section. Click on the days field and select a value from the list. Click the statement field and select a value from the list. Click Save.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle accounts with payment plans defined and enabled under the automated payment plan feature?

text: When the automated payment plan feature is enabled, all accounts with payment plans defined and enabled will be automatically monitored for timely payment.

text.text: Where can I find more detailed information or resources regarding the features and settings discussed under the Configuration tab?

text: You can find more information about the features and settings discussed under the Configuration tab in the ZOLL Billing documentation.

text.text: what are the options in billing process?

text: The billing process section defines the clearinghouse you use by their identifier and HMAC. Here you also select the following options: * Run patient tasks: This setting controls when patient invoices are sent. * Process claim status rules: These are the status change rules such as submitted to follow-up after 30 days, etc. * Submit claims to the clearinghouse: Enable this setting to allow ZOLL Billing to send completed claims to the clearinghouse. * Process clearinghouse remittances: Enable this setting to allow ZOLL Billing to Account Letter casing of patient names and addresses.

text.text: explain Letter casing of patient names and addresses

text: The system defaults to the "Leave patient names and address unchanged" setting. If you leave this enabled, you will be able to control what to cap and what to leave as lower case. Enabling "UPPERCASE new patient names and addresses" will automatically make all new patient names and address uppercase. This includes all names / address that are manually created or imported.

text.text: how can i change a patient name in upper case

text: To change a patient name in upper case, you can use the following steps: 1. Hover over Manage on the navigation bar and then click Settings 2. Click the Configuration tab 3. Scroll down to the Account section 4. Enabling "UPPERCASE new patient names and addresses" will automatically make all new patient names and address uppercase. This includes all names / address that are manually created or imported. Note: You will be given a one-time option to change all existing names and addresses to uppercase. Be advised that this action cannot be undone.

text.text: HOW TO Enable integration check box?

text: ZOLL will work with you to enable the integration with ZOLL Dispatch. As part of the implementation of this integration, ZOLL will check the "Enable integration with ZOLL Dispatch" box.

text.text: How to Enable "Filter by Call Type"?

text: To enable "Filter by Call Type", you can use the following steps: 1. In the "Do not import" box, click a call type to highlight. 2. The "Enable integration with ZOLL Dispatch" option must be checked to configure this setting.

text.text: How to Enable "Filter by Vehicle"?

text: To enable "Filter by Vehicle", you can use the following steps: 1. In the "Do not import" box, click a vehicle to highlight. 2. The "Enable integration with ZOLL Dispatch" option must be checked to configure this setting.

text.text: what are the options available in patient statement?

text: The patient statement section allows you to customize the patient invoice. You can change the header, footer, and body of the invoice. You can also add your logo and company information.

text.text: What are the patient statement vendors?

text: There are several patient statement vendors to choose from. This option will be setup during Onboarding. It is recommended that you do not change it unless you consult with ZOLL first.

text.text: what will be displayed on patient's invoice?

text: The following areas display on the patient's invoice: General statement message, Final statement message, Payment options, Payment portal URL, Upload 'Go Green' image, Customer service, Air ambulance, US Department of Transportation statement.

text.text: give information about deductible monitoring.

text: Deductible Monitoring can operate automatically, with users defining parameters while the system handles the process, or manually, where the Biller manually adjusts the claim's status.

text.text: what is automated payment plan?

text: Automated payment plans allow you to set up a recurring payment for a patient's account. This can be helpful for patients who want to pay their bill in installments. To set up an automated payment plan, you can use the following steps: 1. Go to the patient's account. 2. Click the "Payments" tab. 3. Click the "Create Payment Plan" button. 4. Enter the amount of the payment plan and the number of payments. 5. Click the "Create Payment Plan" button. The patient will then be able to make payments on the plan according to the schedule you set.
